channel.title: Norton Blocking Me From Running Server! HELP!
channel.description: Hi, I'm creating my server, and I'm nearly there, however, when I acces 'compile' and run the server, Norton detects a worm and block my server from running, I do not know how to allow the thing, anybody help me please?

item.title: Norton Blocking Me From Running Server! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @P-K P-K
item.description:
@P-K wrote:

Just make it allow your port that your running the server on =/

Read full topic

item.title: Norton Blocking Me From Running Server! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @deidera deidera
item.description:
@deidera wrote:

[quote=“2hnderspeckr, post:13, topic:41963”]um… wtf??? wtf’s been postin on me? i dont “make servers” i dont even have hamachi or java -.- only able to run um!
som1s been on my account[/quote]

If you don’t have java,you basically cant run moparscape,so again,it’s basically impossible to run a server-because you need moparscape to be runnable,and if you don’t have java you cant use moparscape,but you say you can run a server?.Ok,you can RUN a server,but you need java for that too.If you don’t call me.

BTW if you run the server,but dont have java you can’t play on it using moparscape.

Besides,do what nashi said.

Read full topic
item.source: Norton Blocking Me From Running Server! HELP!

item.title: Norton Blocking Me From Running Server! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

go to norton firewall, click configure, look for the programs list, add the compile.bat and amke it allow connections

Read full topic
item.source: Norton Blocking Me From Running Server! HELP!

item.title: Norton Blocking Me From Running Server! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Have you allowed access to the ports you’re trying to get people to access your server with? Or do you mean it’s not allowing you to run the .bat file or something because it thinks it’s malicious? Some anti-virus programs will class all .bat files as malicious, so that could be your problem. Simply do whatever is available to allow the running of the compiler.bat and runserver.bat files.

Read full topic
